item.title: 联邦通信委员会主席对 Skydance 宣誓改变哥伦比亚广播公司的做法表示满意
item.description: 美国联邦通信委员会主席周四表示，他很高兴天舞公司在与派拉蒙公司的拟议合并案中承诺对哥伦比亚广播公司进行认真改革，但表示该机构尚未就这一合并案做出决定。【原文：The chair of the Federal Communications Commission said on Thursday he is pleased with commitments that Skydance has made to make serious changes at CBS under a proposed merger with Paramount , but said the agency has not made a decision on the tie-up.】

item.title: 奥地利 RBI "终止承认 "Rasperia 公司第二季度 14.1 亿美元的索赔要求
item.description: 奥地利莱弗森国际银行（RBI）周四表示，"终止确认 "2025 年第二季度对 Rasperia 贸易有限公司奥地利资产执行债权的预期收益 12 亿欧元（14.1 亿美元）。【原文：Austria's Raiffeisen Bank International (RBI) on Thursday said it "derecognizes" 1.2 billion euros ($1.41 billion) in expected proceeds from enforcing claims against Rasperia Trading Limited's Austrian assets for the second quarter of 2025.】

item.title: 合同研究公司盈利强劲预示生物技术和制药支出趋于稳定
item.description: 合同研究组织公布的第二季度利润好于预期，华尔街分析师认为，这一迹象反映出生物技术和制药行业在经历了受行业融资紧缩影响的谨慎期后，支出出现反弹。【原文：Contract research organizations are reporting better-than-expected second-quarter profit, a sign that Wall Street analysts say reflects a rebound in biotech and pharmaceutical spending after a cautious stretch driven by tighter sector financing.】

item.title: Accelerant 首次登陆纽交所，股价上涨，估值达 64 亿美元
item.description: Accelerant 公司周四在纽约证券交易所首次亮相时股价大涨 35.7%，使这家由亿万富翁体育金融家托德-博伊利（Todd Boehly）支持的专业保险市场完全稀释后的估值达到 63.7 亿美元。【原文：Accelerant's shares jumped 35.7% in their New York Stock Exchange debut on Thursday, giving the specialty insurance marketplace - backed by billionaire sports financier Todd Boehly - a fully diluted valuation of $6.37 billion.】

item.title: 解说员：特朗普能否合法解雇美联储主席鲍威尔？
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普曾多次表示要解雇美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell），并在周四访问美国中央银行总部之前，称鲍威尔是一个麻木不仁的人，因为他没有削减美国利率。如果特朗普解雇鲍威尔，他将涉足未知的法律领域，考验美联储的历史独立性。【原文：President Donald Trump has repeatedly mused about firing Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell and, ahead of a visit to the U.S. central bank's headquarters on Thursday, called him a numbskull for not cutting U.S. interest rates. If Trump fires Powell, he will be wading into uncharted legal territory by testing the Fed's historical independence.】

item.title: 消息人士称美国考虑对委内瑞拉石油公司进行有限授权
item.description: 周四，四位接近此事的消息人士称，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的政府正准备向委内瑞拉国营石油公司 PDVSA 的主要合作伙伴（从雪佛龙公司开始）授予新的授权，允许他们在这个受到欧佩克制裁的国家有限制地开展业务。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump's administration is preparing to grant new authorizations to key partners of Venezuela's state-run oil company PDVSA, starting with Chevron , which would allow them to operate with limitations in the sanctioned OPEC nation, four sources close to the matter said on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国联邦航空局新任局长称美国空中交通现状不可接受
item.description: 美国联邦航空管理局（Federal Aviation Administration）新任局长周四表示，美国空中交通管制系统老化、人员不足的现状是 "不可接受的"，并誓言要积极开展现代化工作。【原文：The new head of the Federal Aviation Administration said Thursday the current state of the aging, understaffed U.S. air traffic control system is "not acceptable," vowing an aggressive modernization effort.】

item.title: 据 The Verge 报道，OpenAI 准备在八月推出 GPT-5
item.description: 据 The Verge 周四援引熟悉计划的消息人士的话报道，人工智能先驱 OpenAI 计划最早于 8 月份推出其 GPT-5 模型。【原文：Artificial intelligence pioneer OpenAI plans to launch its GPT-5 model as early as August, The Verge reported on Thursday, citing sources familiar with the plans.】

item.title: 欧洲 CISPE 在欧盟法院挑战博通 690 亿美元的 VMware 交易
item.description: 欧盟法官可能会审查芯片制造商博通公司（Broadcom）以 690 亿美元收购云计算公司 VMWare 的交易，此前有反垄断投诉反对欧盟批准科技行业最大的收购案之一。【原文：European Union judges could review chipmaker Broadcom's $69 billion acquisition of cloud computing firm VMWare, after an antitrust complaint opposed the bloc's approval of one of the biggest takeovers in the technology industry.】

item.title: Alphabet 遭到六家数字版权组织的欧盟反垄断投诉
item.description: 周四，六家人权和数字权利组织向欧盟提出反垄断申诉，敦促欧盟监管机构调查这家科技巨头是否遵守了要求其让用户更容易卸载软件应用程序的法律。【原文：Alphabet was targeted with an EU antitrust complaint from six human and digital rights groups on Thursday which urged EU regulators to investigate whether the tech giant complies with legislation requiring it to make it easier for users to uninstall software apps.】

item.title: 雪佛龙公司告诉赫斯公司员工在等待工作更新的同时关注安全问题
item.description: 据两位接受路透社采访的赫斯公司员工称，雪佛龙公司的领导告诉赫斯公司的员工要继续专注于安全运营，他们将在下周得知在这家石油生产商被收购后他们是否还能继续工作。【原文：Chevron leaders told Hess employees to stay focused on safe operations and that they will hear next week if they will continue to have jobs following the oil producer's acquisition, according to two Hess employees who spoke with Reuters.】

item.title: 麦格劳-希尔首次登陆纽交所，股票以面值开盘，估值达 32.5 亿美元
item.description: 美国出版商麦格劳-希尔公司（McGraw Hill）的估值为 32.5 亿美元，其股票周四在纽约首次公开发行时以面值开盘，暗示投资者对首次公开发行市场的反应不一。【原文：U.S. publisher McGraw Hill was valued at $3.25 billion and its shares opened at par in their New York debut on Thursday, hinting at a mixed response from investors in the IPO market.】

item.title: Opendoor、Kohl's 恢复上涨，备忘录股票狂潮仍在继续
item.description: 周四，零售业宠儿开放之门科技公司（Opendoor Technologies）和科尔百货公司（Kohl's）的股价重拾涨势，这主要得益于 "备忘录股 "的持续亢奋和大盘屡创新高。【原文：Shares of retail favorites Opendoor Technologies and Kohl's resumed their rally on Thursday, fueled by continued meme stock euphoria and broader markets hitting record highs.】

item.title: 康卡斯特任命媒体分拆董事会成员
item.description: 康卡斯特周四任命了 Versant Media Group 的首届董事会成员，该集团计划分拆，接管 NBCUniversal 旗下大部分有线电视网络，包括 USA Network、CNBC 和 MSNBC。【原文：Comcast on Thursday named the members to the first board of Versant Media Group, its planned spinoff that will take over a bulk of NBCUniversal's cable networks, including USA Network, CNBC and MSNBC.】

item.title: 奢侈品行业等待美国贸易协议，LVMH 销售额低于预期
item.description: 奢侈品行业的领头羊路威酩轩集团（LVMH）周四报告称，该集团季度销售额下降了4%，略低于预期，但集团首席财务官塞西尔-卡巴尼斯（Cecile Cabanis）表示对今年下半年充满信心。【原文：Luxury bellwether LVMH reported a slightly worse than expected 4% decline in quarterly sales on Thursday, though CFO Cecile Cabanis expressed confidence for the rest of the year.】

item.title: 米其林上半年销售额符合市场预期
item.description: 法国轮胎制造商米其林公布，今年上半年销售额下降了 3.4%，符合市场预期，因为销售量的下降被销售价格的上涨部分抵消。【原文：French tyre maker Michelin reported a 3.4% decline in sales in the first half of the year, in line with market expectations, as a fall in sales volumes was partly offset by higher selling prices.】

item.title: 巴西 WEG 预计将减轻特朗普关税的大部分影响
item.description: 巴西电机制造商 WEG 周四表示，预计美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）表示将对巴西商品征收 50% 的关税，该公司将通过调整部分出口路线来抵消这一关税带来的大部分影响。【原文：Brazilian motor maker WEG said on Thursday it expects to offset most of the impact from the 50% tariff U.S. President Donald Trump said he would impose on Brazilian goods partly by adjusting some export routes.】

item.title: 消息人士称，欧洲央行决策者为 9 月降息设定了高标准
item.description: 两位消息人士告诉路透社，欧洲央行决策者为 9 月份降息设定了很高的门槛，他们需要看到经济增长和通胀大幅恶化，才会支持进一步宽松政策。【原文：European Central Bank policymakers are setting a high bar for an interest rate cut in September and they would need to see a significant deterioration in growth and inflation before backing further easing, two sources told Reuters.】

item.title: 利润增长四倍后，墨西哥贝科公司股价大涨
item.description: 世界最大的龙舌兰酒生产商墨西哥贝克公司周四公布第二季度利润大幅增长，股价上涨 4%。【原文：Shares in Mexico's Becle , the world's largest tequila producer, rose 4% on Thursday, after the company reported a sharp profit increase in the second quarter.】

item.title: 仲量联行退出纽约罗斯福酒店销售顾问职位
item.description: 巴基斯坦周四表示，为避免客户利益冲突，全球房地产公司仲量联行（JLL）已放弃担任巴基斯坦国际航空公司旗下纽约罗斯福酒店部分出售项目的财务顾问。【原文：Global real estate firm Jones Lang LaSalle (JLL) has quit its role as financial adviser on the partial sale of the Roosevelt Hotel in New York City, which is owned by Pakistan International Airlines, to avoid client conflict of interest, Pakistan said on Thursday.】

item.title: 亚马逊在英国面临零售商和消费者价值高达 54 亿美元的诉讼
item.description: 亚马逊因涉嫌滥用其市场支配地位而面临零售商和消费者价值高达 40 亿英镑（约合 54 亿美元）的两起大规模诉讼，伦敦一家法庭周四证明这两起案件可以继续审理。【原文：Amazon faces two mass lawsuits from retailers and consumers worth up to 4 billion pounds ($5.4 billion) for allegedly abusing its dominant position, after a London tribunal on Thursday certified the cases could proceed.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚广播公司新闻频道（CBS News）在特朗普官司之后任命坦尼娅-西蒙为《60 分钟》的新老板
item.description: 派拉蒙全球公司（Paramount Global）旗下的哥伦比亚广播公司（CBS News）周四任命谭雅-西蒙（Tanya Simon）为其黄金时段新闻杂志广播节目《60 分钟》的执行制片人，接替以缺乏编辑独立性为由下台的比尔-欧文斯（Bill Owens）。【原文：Paramount Global's CBS News on Thursday appointed Tanya Simon as the executive producer of its prime time news magazine broadcast "60 Minutes", in place of Bill Owens, who had stepped down citing lack of editorial independence.】

item.title: 加拿大零售业因关税影响而萎缩，6 月份有望好转
item.description: 周四的数据显示，由于消费者减少购买汽车，在超市、便利店和酒类上的消费减少，加拿大5月份的零售额下降了1.1%。【原文：Canada's retail sales shrank by 1.1% in May as consumers curtailed car purchases and spent less at supermarkets, convenience stores and on alcohol, data showed on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国 6 月新屋销售低于预期；住房供应增加
item.description: 由于抵押贷款利率上升，6 月份美国新建独栋住宅的销量增幅低于预期，库存量达到了 2007 年底的水平，这可能使住宅建设继续受到抑制。【原文：Sales of new U.S. single-family homes increased less than expected in June amid higher mortgage rates, pushing inventory to levels last seen in late 2007, which could keep homebuilding subdued.】

item.title: 马斯克称视频分享应用 Vine 将 "以人工智能的形式 "回归
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的社交媒体公司 X 将以 "人工智能形式 "重新推出流行的视频分享平台 Vine，这位亿万富翁级的科技企业家在该应用停用近九年后的本周四表示。【原文：Elon Musk's social media company X is bringing back popular video-sharing platform Vine in "AI form", the billionaire tech-entrepreneur said on Thursday, almost nine years after the app was discontinued.】

item.title: 英特尔胜诉320亿美元股价暴跌引发的股东诉讼
item.description: 联邦法官驳回了一起指控英特尔欺诈股东的诉讼，该诉讼指控英特尔隐瞒了为外部客户生产芯片的业务中存在的问题，导致其市值单日暴跌 320 亿美元。【原文：A federal judge dismissed a lawsuit accusing Intel of defrauding shareholders by concealing problems in a business where it manufactured chips for outside customers, leading to a $32 billion one-day plunge in its market value.】

item.title: 美国商务部长卢特尼克称，TikTok 必须退出中国控制，由美国控制算法
item.description: 美国商务部长霍华德-卢特尼克（Howard Lutnick）周四告诉CNBC，TikTok必须脱离中国的控制，华盛顿应监督该社交媒体平台的算法。【原文：U.S. Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick told CNBC on Thursday that TikTok must be taken out of Chinese control and that Washington should oversee the social media platform's algorithm.】

item.title: 欧盟监管机构将调查 KKR 是否在意大利电信交易中提供了误导性信息
item.description: 欧盟委员会周四表示，欧盟反垄断监管机构将调查美国投资公司 KKR 在以 220 亿欧元（260 亿美元）收购意大利电信公司（TIM）固网交易中是否提供了错误或误导性信息。【原文：EU antitrust regulators will investigate whether U.S. investment firm KKR provided incorrect or misleading information in its 22-billion-euro ($26 billion) acquisition of Telecom Italia's (TIM) fixed-line network deal, the European Commission said on Thursday.】

item.title: 特朗普表示希望马斯克及其公司在美国蓬勃发展
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周四表示，他不会通过取消联邦补贴来摧毁埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的公司，并表示他希望这位亿万富翁科技企业家的企业能够蓬勃发展。【原文：President Donald Trump said on Thursday he would not destroy Elon Musk's companies by taking away federal subsidies and said he wants the billionaire tech-entrepreneur's businesses to thrive.】

item.title: 美国商业活动增长；关税加剧通胀担忧
item.description: 美国 7 月份的商业活动有所回升，但企业要求提高商品和服务价格，这支持了经济学家的观点，即通胀将在下半年加速，主要原因是对进口商品征收关税。【原文：U.S. business activity picked up in July, but companies asked higher prices for goods and services, supporting economists' views that inflation will accelerate in the second half of the year mainly because of tariffs on imports.】
